result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:35 AM Defendant Dylan Robert Cleveland in court.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn in court for Dylan Robert Cleveland.  Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.  Defense files a bond motion.  State is in Chapter 950 compliance.  State files an amended complaint.  Rec'd, reading waived, ng plea entered.  Defense asks that the defendant be allowed to drive if properly licensed.  Suspension is forthcoming.  State objects for the record.  If the court does modify the bond the State asks that an IID is installed.  BTC: Bond modification granted to allow the defendant to drive if properly licensed, properly insured and an IID is installed in the car the defendant is driving. If an occupational is obtained, all geographical and time limitations are a bond condition.  BTC: Bond will be modified accordingly once the defendant shows proof of all the conditions given by the court.  IID, license and insurance.
Bail/bond hearing on August 29, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

***ALSO $5,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive at all.

1:47 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dylan Robert Cleveland appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan appeared by video for Dylan Robert Cleveland. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
